metadata.dc:author: Echavarría Ibargüengaitia, J L
Rodríguez Cueto, G
Portilla Aguilar, J
metadata.dc:description: We report a case of gas embolism secondary to the use of positive end respriatory pressure in a newborn with ideopathic respiratory syndrome. The anatomicopathological findings lead to the hypothesis that the gas migrates from the broken alveoli through the lymphatic vessels to the venous circulation.
metadata.dc:title: Embolia gaseosa masiva en un recién nacido tratado con respirador de presión positiva
[Massive air embolism in a newborn infant treated with a positive-pressure respirator].
metadata.dc:publisher: Boletin medico del Hospital Infantil de Mexico
